senses.synonym: 05994011-n (a cultural unit (an idea or value or pattern of behavior) that is passed from one person to another by non-genetic means (as by imitation); \""memes are the cultural counterpart of genes\""

relations.target: gene=05444328-n ((genetics) a segment of DNA that is involved in producing a polypeptide chain; it can include regions preceding and following the coding DNA as well as introns between the exons; it is considered a unit of heredity; \""genes were formerly called factors\""

mind=00611060-v (keep in mind);00726454-v (be concerned with or about something or somebody);00726626-v (be on one's guard; be cautious or wary about; be alert to; \""Beware of telephone salesmen\"");00850387-v (be offended or bothered by; take offense with, be bothered by; \""I don't mind your behavior\"");02442554-v (be in charge of or deal with; \""She takes care of all the necessary arrangements\"");02577816-v (pay close attention to; give heed to; \""Heed the advice of the old men\"");05619057-n (that which is responsible for one's thoughts, feelings, and conscious brain functions; the seat of the faculty of reason; \""his mind wandered\""; \""I couldn't get his words out of my head\"");05626632-n (knowledge and intellectual ability; \""he reads to improve his mind\""; \""he has a keen intellect\"");05711903-n (attention; \""don't pay him any mind\"");05770146-n (recall or remembrance; \""it came to mind\"");05846466-n (an opinion formed by judging something; \""he was reluctant to make his judgment known\""; \""she changed her mind\"");05991800-n (your intention; what you intend to do; \""he had in mind to see his old teacher\""; \""the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces\"");10727941-n (an important intellectual; \""the great minds of the 17th century\""

action=00038116-n (something done (usually as opposed to something said); \""there were stories of murders and other unnatural actions\"");00577488-n (the most important or interesting work or activity in a specific area or field; \""the action is no longer in technology stocks but in municipal bonds\""; \""gawkers always try to get as close to the action as possible\"");00955074-n (a military engagement; \""he saw action in Korea\"");01184392-n (a judicial proceeding brought by one party against another; one party prosecutes another for a wrong done or for protection of a right or for prevention of a wrong);01184802-n (an act by a government body or supranational organization; \""recent federal action undermined the segregationist position\""; \""the United Nations must have the power to propose and organize action without being hobbled by irrelevant issues\""; \""the Union action of emancipating Southern slaves\"");02680572-n (the operating part that transmits power to a mechanism; \""the piano had a very stiff action\"");04843181-n (the trait of being active and energetic and forceful; \""a man of action\"");06385136-n (the series of events that form a plot; \""his novels always have a lot of action\"");13540166-n (a process existing in or produced by nature (rather than by the intent of human beings); \""the action of natural forces\""; \""volcanic activity\"");14030430-n (the state of being active; \""his sphere of activity\""; \""he is out of action\"");01644397-v (put in effect; \""carry out a task\""; \""execute the decision of the people\""; \""He actioned the operation\"");02588127-v (institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against; \""He was warned that the district attorney would process him\""; \""She actioned the company for discrimination\""

repeat=07356649-n (an event that repeats; \""the events today were a repeat of yesterday's\"");00343988-v (happen or occur again; \""This is a recurring story\"");00959711-v (to say again or imitate; \""followers echoing the cries of their leaders\"");00960366-v (to say, state, or perform again; \""She kept reiterating her request\"");01731369-v (repeat an earlier theme of a composition);01738383-v (make or do or perform again; \""He could never replicate his brilliant performance of the magic trick\"");02601659-v (do over; \""They would like to take it over again\""
verbally=00129340-r (by means of language; \""verbally expressive\"");00129438-r (as a verb; \""he had a habit of using nouns verbally\""

transmit=00975088-v (broadcast over the airwaves, as in radio or television; \""We cannot air this X-rated song\"");01438013-v (send from one person or place to another; \""transmit a message\"");02084180-v (transmit or serve as the medium for transmission; \""Sound carries well over water\""; \""The airwaves carry the sound\""; \""Many metals conduct heat\"");02236443-v (transfer to another; \""communicate a disease\""

idea=05811387-n (an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth; \""an estimate of what it would cost\""; \""a rough idea how long it would take\"");05842164-n (the content of cognition; the main thing you are thinking about; \""it was not a good idea\""; \""the thought never entered my mind\"");05846174-n (a personal view; \""he has an idea that we don't like him\"");05991800-n (your intention; what you intend to do; \""he had in mind to see his old teacher\""; \""the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces\"");07042734-n ((music) melodic subject of a musical composition; \""the theme is announced in the first measures\""; \""the accompanist picked up the idea and elaborated it\""

practice=00411260-n (a customary way of operation or behavior; \""it is their practice to give annual raises\""; \""they changed their dietary pattern\"");00412061-n (translating an idea into action; \""a hard theory to put into practice\""; \""differences between theory and praxis of communism\"");00632621-n (the exercise of a profession; \""the practice of the law\""; \""I took over his practice when he retired\"");00896250-n (systematic training by multiple repetitions; \""practice makes perfect\"");05675040-n (knowledge of how something is usually done; \""it is not the local practice to wear shorts to dinner\"");00607488-v (learn by repetition; \""We drilled French verbs every day\""; \""Pianists practice scales\"");01727101-v (engage in a rehearsal (of));02380559-v (engage in or perform; \""practice safe sex\""; \""commit a random act of kindness\"");02567247-v (avail oneself to; \""apply a principle\""; \""practice a religion\""; \""use care when going down the stairs\""; \""use your common sense\""; \""practice non-violent resistance\"");02574587-v (carry out or practice; as of jobs and professions; \""practice law\""

information=05098731-n ((communication theory) a numerical measure of the uncertainty of an outcome; \""the signal contained thousands of bits of information\"");05824413-n (knowledge acquired through study or experience or instruction);06646883-n (a message received and understood);07252221-n (formal accusation of a crime);08479331-n (a collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn; \""statistical data\""

cultural=02256437-a (denoting or deriving from or distinctive of the ways of living built up by a group of people; \""influenced by ethnic and cultural ties\""- J.F.Kennedy; \""ethnic food\"");02883666-a (relating to the raising of plants or animals; \""a cultural variety\"");02883805-a (of or relating to the shared knowledge and values of a society; \""cultural roots\"");02910174-a (of or relating to the arts and manners that a group favors; \""cultural events\""; \""a person of broad cultural interests\""

senses.definition: Any unit of cultural information, such as a practice or idea, that is transmitted verbally or by repeated action from one mind to another in a comparable way to the transmission of genes
